HUC4NAME "UPPER SPOKANE" VB #CopyFeatures C:\Python27\GISADMIN_to_SQLPROD.sde\DEQGIS83.DBO.SWA_Delineations C:\Python27\AGOL\SWA_Delineations.shp # # # #Rename C:\Python27\AGOL\SWA_DELINEATIONS.shp C:\Python27\AGOL\IDEQ_SWA_DELINEATIONS ShapeFile1.0FGDC CSDGM Metadata1500000005000FGDCProcess description: The delineations can be divided into fixed radius and modeled delineations. Fixed radius delineations (surface water and transient sources) were delineated by IDEQ staff using buffering tools. All transient systems were selected from the Public Water System dataset (PWS) and buffered at 1000 meters. Surfacewater systems were delineated at both 4- and 24-hour time of travel and bufferd at 500 meters. To determine surface water time of travel, IDEQ staff utilized USGS annual average stream flow data to determine distance upstream from the source in 4- and 10-hours. The distance upstream was measured off of USGS 1:100000-scale hydrology datasets and the stream segments buffered. Modeled delineations were delineated by either IDEQ staff, Washington Group International (WGI) contract staff, Barr Engineering Company staff, or University of Idaho hydrology staff. Sources were modeled using WHAeM, a hydrologic modeling tool, and the 3-, 6-, &10-year time of travel paths were exported as AutoCAD dxf formatted files. ArcView was used to on-screen digitize a shapefile from the linear dxf files. Both the fixed radius and modeled delineations attribute tables were formatted using an Avenue tool in ArcView. The corrected shapefiles were then used as an input layer in the Potential Contaminant Inventory (PCI) process. 20120105Sean CoyleIDEQGIS Analyst208.373.0502mailing and physical address1410 N HiltonBoiseIdaho83706208.373.0502sean.coyle@deq.idaho.govhttp://www.deq.idaho.gov/water-quality/drinking-water/drinking-water-protection/source-water-assessments.aspxhttp://mapcase.deq.idaho.gov/swa199801012011070520110705EPA19970708Source Water Protection1PDfhttp://www.epa.gov/safewater/sourcewater/pubs/swpguidance.pdf1:100,000digitialhttp://www.epa.gov/safewater/sourcewater/pubs/swpguidance.pdfThese data are modeled approximations of groundwater capture zones. A conservative deductive estimate for horizontal accuracy is 250 meters. Be advised however, that these data were not developed to be a precise delineation but more a general estimate.Polygons closedUpdated as necessaryMicrosoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770enDelineations, also know as capture zones, were created as part of the State of Idaho Source Water Protection program. The delineations can be classified as one of two categories: fixed radius and modeled. Transient and surface water systems were delineated with the fixed radius method. The remaining systems were delineated utilizing groundwater modeling. Most delineations are structured as three polygons depicting 3-, 6-, & 10-year time of travel zone.These datasets are part of the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality's Source Water Protection program.Idaho Department of Environmental Quality20120105Source Water Delineationsdeqgis83.DBO.SWA_Delineationsvector digital dataUnknownIdahoIdaho DEQhttp://mapcase.deq.idaho.gov/swahttp://inside.uidaho.edu/asp/IDEQ.asphttp://www.deq.idaho.gov/water-quality/drinking-water/drinking-water-protection/source-water-assessments.aspxpublication date20120105CompleteAs needed-117.507668-110.50447749.02629541.8849812243323.4285622755786.0952281191858.4439271980602.657794SourcewaterSourcewater Protection, Drinking Water Protection, Wells, Spring, Surface IntakeIdaho, Pacific Northwest, United StatesNoneNeither the State of Idaho nor the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality, nor any of their employees make any warranty, express or implied, or assume any legal liability or responsibility for the accuracy, completeness or usefulness of any information or data provided. Hilton RdBoiseID83706USA208-373-0573Sean.coyle@deq.idaho.govIDEQMicrosoft Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview Version 10.0 (Build 14393) ; Esri ArcGIS 12.9.0.31663Source Water DelineationsSean CoyleIdaho Dept of Environmental QualityGIS Analyst1410 N Hilton BoiseID83706sean.coyle@deq.idaho.gov208 373-05738:00 - 5:00 MSTSean CoyleSean Coyle2023-03-21T00:00:002019-09-16T00:00:002000-06-01T00:00:0020211017Source Water Assessment and ProtectionCurrent Status2243323.4285622755786.0952281980602.6577941191858.4439271Idaho Source Water Time of Travel Zones.1997-01-01T00:00:002020-03-18T00:00:00-117.507668-110.50447749.02629541.8849811These datasets are part of the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality's Source Water Protection program. Source water assessments are the cornerstone for source water protection. Local communities can use the information gathered through the assessment process to create a broader source water protection program to address current problems and prevent future threats to the quality of their drinking water supplies. The information acquired from assessments also assists DEQ in overseeing public water systems.

Delineations, also know as capture zones, were created as part of the State of Idaho Source Water Protection program. The delineations can be classified as one of two categories: fixed radius and modeled. Transient and surface water systems were delineated with the fixed radius method. The remaining systems were delineated utilizing groundwater modeling. Most delineations are structured as three polygons depicting 3-, 6-, & 10-year time of travel zone.

Idaho Department of Environmental Quality Last update - 3/21/2023Source Water ProtectionDrinking Water ProtectionWellsSpringSurface IntakePublic Water SuppliesSafe Water Drinking ActEPAIdahoIdaho DEQIdaho GISIdaho Dept of Environmental QualityState Government
